comments:
If the user adds a non-existant variable string to the classpath we fail 
launching with an internal error:

org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Assert$AssertionFailedException: Assertion 
failed; Path for IClasspathEntry must be absolute
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:89)
at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore.newLibraryEntry(JavaCore.java:3033)
at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore.newLibraryEntry(JavaCore.java:2906)
at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.newArchiveRuntimeClasspathEntry
(JavaRuntime.java:541)
at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.VariableClasspathResolver.resolveRuntimeClas
spathEntry(VariableClasspathResolver.java:47)
at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.VariableClasspathResolver.resolveRuntimeClas
spathEntry(VariableClasspathResolver.java:33)
at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.RuntimeClasspathEntryResolver.resolveRuntime
ClasspathEntry(RuntimeClasspathEntryResolver.java:43)
at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.resolveRuntimeClasspathEntry
(JavaRuntime.java:840)
at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.StandardClasspathProvider.resolveClasspath
(StandardClasspathProvider.java:65)
at org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.resolveRuntimeClasspath
(JavaRuntime.java:1098)
at 
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.getClasspath
(AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:401)
at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDeleg
ate.launch(JavaLocalApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:79)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:569)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUIPlugin.java:732)
at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:904)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

The worst part of this is you are left with zombie launches that you cannot 
remove from the debug view.

When I do this I get an error dialog with "Launch failed", "Reference to 
undefined variable". What steps did you use?

Ah - got it. If the variable is of the wrong format, like "fred" instead 
of "${fred}".
Not a regression, don't need to fix for M3.

Fixed.
It says the path must be absolute, I made it absolute.
Changes in VariableClasspathResolver.
Shouldn't I get the same error as when referencing an undefined variable?

I don't know. From what I see, you can add pretty much anything in the text
field. You have to use the ${var} notation to get a variable translated. Having
some text without variables in it doesn't seem to be an error.

traces.message: Assertion  failed; Path for IClasspathEntry must be absolute
